pie.

The first thing we need to make our base is
we need some biscuits and some melted butter.

The first thing we need to make our base is

yah

And then once they are all crushed up we can
tip them into the bowl with the melted butter
and stir that together.

So once that is all nicely mixed tip that
into the bowl.

Ohhhhh,
And then you want to spread it out all the

way to the edges so that the caramel doesn't
get stuck to the dish you want it to be on
the pie crumbs.
And that's the next we need to make our caramel.

What we need is some sugar some glucose syrup,
some water, some cream

Put the water and the glucose syrup into a

saucepan and stir it over high heat until
the sugar is dissolved.

Then wash down the sides of the pan using
a wet pastry brush and let it boil unstirred
until it starts to go golden brown.

Shake the pan a little until you get a nice
even colour then add in your cream.

And yes it is very hot, so you need to be
careful.

Stir that until it's all smooth and then heat
it for about 30 seconds more and then pour
it into your crumb base.
